The test errors are not related...

```
3333108 [INFO] Ambari Web ......................................... FAILURE [ 48.003 s]
```

Caused by: 
```
57201 [ERROR] error /home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/Ambari-Github-PullRequest-Builder/ambari-web/node_modules/phantomjs-prebuilt: Command failed.
57201 [ERROR] Exit code: 1
57201 [ERROR] Command: sh
57201 [ERROR] Arguments: -c node install.js
57201 [ERROR] Directory: /home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/Ambari-Github-PullRequest-Builder/ambari-web/node_modules/phantomjs-prebuilt
57201 [ERROR] Output:
57201 [ERROR] PhantomJS not found on PATH
57201 [ERROR] Download already available at /tmp/npm_config_tmp/phantomjs/phantomjs-2.1.1-linux-x86_64.tar.bz2
57201 [ERROR] Verified checksum of previously downloaded file
57201 [ERROR] Extracting tar contents (via spawned process)
57201 [ERROR] Error extracting archive
57201 [ERROR] Phantom installation failed { [Error: Command failed: tar jxf /tmp/npm_config_tmp/phantomjs/phantomjs-2.1.1-linux-x86_64.tar.bz2
```

The relevant test suite passed:
```
3333109 [INFO] Ambari Server ...................................... SUCCESS [33:41 min]
```

@mradha25 , one line code change:

diff --git a/ambari-server/src/main/resources/stack-hooks/after-INSTALL/scripts/shared_initialization.py b/ambari-server/src/main/resources/stack-hooks/after-INSTALL/scripts/shared_initialization.py
index 9a596feb82..87ce677e29 100644
--- a/ambari-server/src/main/resources/stack-hooks/after-INSTALL/scripts/shared_initialization.py
+++ b/ambari-server/src/main/resources/stack-hooks/after-INSTALL/scripts/shared_initialization.py
@@ -84,7 +84,7 @@ def setup_config():
     XmlConfig("core-site.xml",
               conf_dir=params.hadoop_conf_dir,
               configurations=params.module_configs.get_all_properties(params.module_name, 'core-site'),
-              configuration_attributes=params.execution_command.get_all_attributes(params.module_name, 'core-site'),
+              configuration_attributes=params.module_configs.get_all_attributes(params.module_name, 'core-site'),
               owner=params.hdfs_user,
               group=params.user_group,
               only_if=format("ls {hadoop_conf_dir}"))

@mradha25 Please review it. Thanks.

Please give an appropriate jira number to the Pull request commit message of the format 
[Apache jira number] Description/Heading
@mradha25 Thanks, I do not close AMBARI-23508, I will use this jira number to do more work on execution_command package if there have other issues.

> AMBARI-23552. Switch to using Surrogate PK in Ambari DB tables, where…  …
> …ver applicable.

Updated code based on above review comments.

Sure, you can continue to work on it but might be better if you can follow the template so that it gets auto-associated to the appropriate jira in apache.
Only if you follow the template all your pull requests related to AMBARI-23508 will be linked to the jira and will be very helpful for tracking. Thanks

```

Thank-you @aonishuk  and @swagle for reviewing and merging the patch.
Thank-you @aonishuk  and @swagle for reviewing and merging the patch, will create another pr with unit-tests for the same.

```

  File "ambari-agent/src/test/python/ambari_agent/TestCustomServiceOrchestrator.py", line 340, in test_cancel_command

```

@rnettleton When merging this, please make sure to select "Squash and merge" from the dropdown.

https://help.github.com/articles/about-pull-request-merges/#squash-and-merge-your-pull-request-commits

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/Ambari-Github-PullRequest-Builder/1830/
Test FAILed.
Test FAILured.
retest this  please

@thaibui `start-build-env.sh` does not work with docker-machine.  The mounts are specific to your localhost and do not exist on the virtualbox.  It would fail to start docker for the mvn command, so I don't think this is your problem.  You can check whether you are using docker-machine via the command: `env | grep DOCKER_HOST`.

I cannot reproduce these failures in CustomServiceOrch. And debug logging I added doesn't show anything intersting. I will commit these two tests with disabled CustomServiceOrch.  @adoroszlai if you want you can investigate the failures (I see you can repro them) and create a fix for that separately.
